definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: It is a little pity that the dry battery of my MP3 is dead now.
sentences.chinese: 有點遺憾的是，現在我MP3的乾電池沒電了。

sentences.english: I’ve only sparked it a bit to keep the battery alive.
sentences.chinese: 我只發動了幾次，防止電瓶沒電了。

sentences.english: The battery is dead. The car won't start.
sentences.chinese: 電池沒電了，車子發動不起來。

sentences.english: After all, none of the functions work once the phone’s battery is dead.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，一旦手機電池沒電了，那些功能將全部喪失。

sentences.english: Without power, those emptied freezers were defrosted.
We have a dead battery now, I'd better put this car in service.
sentences.chinese: 電池沒電了，我想我該把車送去保養了。

sentences.english: It rang continuously for five and a half hours before it finally ran out of batteries.
sentences.chinese: 於是鬧鐘一直響了五個半小時沒電了才停下來。

sentences.english: My phone had died during the evening so I couldn't call anyone.
sentences.chinese: 手機昨天傍晚就沒電了，我沒法打電話給任何人。

sentences.english: Traffic lights off. Hospitals deprived of electricity.
sentences.chinese: 紅綠燈也關了，連醫院都沒電。

definition: to recharge (a battery)/(fig.) to recharge one's batteries (through leisure)/to update one's skills and knowledge
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
power switch/gas valve/to open the city (or frontier) gate/to open and close/to switch on and off
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to have water get in (one's ear, shoes etc)/to get flooded/inflow of water
